definition: owner/master/host/individual or party concerned/God/Lord/main/to indicate or signify/trump card (in card games)
line of business/industry/occupation/job/employment/school studies/enterprise/property/(Buddhism) karma/deed/to engage in/already

sentences.english: He is a tradesman and belongs to referee department of Molfetta, Bari.
sentences.chinese: 他的主业是商人，隶属于墨菲塔裁判大区。

sentences.english: That was her real, main job.
Where is the way out for the profession of geological exploration in the difficult position at present?
sentences.chinese: 目前处于困境中地勘行业主业的出路何在呢？

sentences.english: Ma Yun's main business is still teaching, can only use their spare time to take care of translation.
sentences.chinese: 马云的主业还是教书，只能用课余时间打理翻译社。

sentences.english: His main career is running a pet hospital, but he is also a vet.
sentences.chinese: 他的主业是经营宠物医院，但他同时还是一个兽医。

sentences.english: Jeck: Do you read your gastbook often?
Perhaps all this pre-professionalism is a bad thing.
sentences.chinese: 也许所有的提前实习主业是意见坏事。

definition: achievement/accomplishment/(in more recent usage) performance (of a business, employee etc)/results
merger and acquisition (M and A)/acquisition/to take over
arrogant/to put on airs/(business etc) to expand/to enlarge/to do sth on a big scale
to engage in (business etc)/to run/to operate
industry chain (concept proposed by US scholar Michael Porter in 1985)
to start out by/to grow an enterprise beginning with/to begin one's career by
